ab.head:
Hornby.
―
ab.p:
William McLaughlin, a prosperous
farmer, died Feb. 22, at an advanced age.
He had been a resident for many years,
and was an active farmer. He was a
soldier in the Civil War. He was much
respected as a aa man and citizen. He
died of cancer of the face, after a long ill‐
ness. Deceased leaves a wife and nine
children. There are seven sons, James,
George, Charles, William, Daniel, Thomas,
Frank; and two daughters, Mrs. N.Ann Har‐
rison and Mrs. Catherine Hendricks. The
funeral was held at St. Mary’s Church
in Corning at 10 a. m. Monday, and
the burial was in St. Mary’s Ceme‐
tery.

The services consisted of a requiem
high mass conducted by Rev. J. M. Bus‐
tin. The bearers were the six sons of the
deceased, James, George, Charles, Wil‐
liam Daniel and Frank.
